newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgian CBR plunges six percent.
newsitem.headline: Belgian CBR plunges six percent.

text.p: Shares in Belgium's leading cement maker CBR, a unit of Germany's Heidelberger Zement, plunged six percent on Tuesday, with traders putting it down to profit-taking after its recent bull run.
"With CBR's recent bullishness it's bound to suffer more than others from a market downturn," said one trader.
By 1100 GMT the share was down 5.23 percent at 3,260 francs after earlier touching a low of 3,240 francs.
CBR was the hardest hit stock among the blue chip shares. The blue chip Bel-20 .BFX index was down 2.81 percent.
